thread.title: New Day Cafe: Keepin' Warm With Friends
thread.title_full: New Day Cafe: Keepin' Warm With Friends

author: @TheMartiScott
title: New Day Cafe: Keepin' Warm With Friends
text: Good morning, Cafe! Hope everyone is safe and well and warm! The cold weather is being downright mean to entirely too many of us, so please to get yourself a hot drink, something tasty and cuddle up to join us for a bit. All are welcome to join the fun, the silliness, the conversations. If you don‚Äôt know...just ask! Some things really do require a bit of explanation. There will be a few surprises along the way, all good ones, we hope. We are here to keep building the Daily Kos Community. We post Mon-Sun at 10:30 a.m. Eastern. Pie fights will be met with outrageous ridicule and insults. Trolls will be incinerated and served at the next group BBQ. As briquettes. Who else needed this today? üòÇüîä Sound up! pic.twitter.com/2m8nYdIuc4‚Äî Jessi üí´ (@its_jessi_grace) January 12, 2024 Who else needed this today? üòÇüîä Sound up! pic.twitter.com/2m8nYdIuc4 Meanwhile‚Ä¶.They say the sea is cold, but the sea contains the hottest blood of all, and the wildest, the most urgent. All the whales in the wider deeps, hot are they, as they urge on and on, and dive beneath the icebergs. Whales weep not. WHALE, HELLO THERE: A whale put on a show off the coast of Norway and gave a group on a whale-watching tour an experience they'll never forget. https://t.co/qqieg18hwJ pic.twitter.com/nUSF7CjTQH‚Äî ABC News (@ABC) January 13, 2024 WHALE, HELLO THERE: A whale put on a show off the coast of Norway and gave a group on a whale-watching tour an experience they'll never forget. https://t.co/qqieg18hwJ pic.twitter.com/nUSF7CjTQH Archeologists have uncovered a cluster of lost cities in the Amazon rainforest that was home to at least 10,000 farmers around 2,000 years ago. https://t.co/z2IxWI3Bv0‚Äî WJZ | CBS Baltimore (@wjz) January 13, 2024 Archeologists have uncovered a cluster of lost cities in the Amazon rainforest that was home to at least 10,000 farmers around 2,000 years ago. https://t.co/z2IxWI3Bv0 NEWS: Greece Reopens the Palace Where Alexander the Great Was Crowned. https://t.co/1ZVwgnIfEH pic.twitter.com/inU95UbyC5‚Äî World History Encyclopedia (@whencyclopedia) January 13, 2024 NEWS: Greece Reopens the Palace Where Alexander the Great Was Crowned. https://t.co/1ZVwgnIfEH pic.twitter.com/inU95UbyC5 The end of an era‚Ä¶.I remember watching Bill on Days Of Our Lives when I was in high school. As a matter of fact, it was his storyline with Addie that I first remember. My mum started watching because Days came on right after the news at lunch time. Then, she had the nerve to get ME hooked on it! LOL We talked about it for years afterward, if I wasn‚Äôt working and had to miss it. Or, she‚Äôd watch it and bring me up to speed. Bill Hayes was the first to sing on a Soap, too!
